definition: pincers/pliers/tongs/claw (of animal)/to grasp with pincers/to pinch/to clamp/to restrain/to restrict/to gag

sentences.english: Secure all work with clamps or a vise, freeing both hands to operate tools.
sentences.chinese: 使用夾鉗或虎鉗固定工件，以便空出雙手來操作工具。

sentences.english: She defeated the bad guy by virtue of her courage and by a pair of vices.
sentences.chinese: 由於她的勇氣和藉助一對老虎鉗，她打敗了那個壞蛋。

sentences.english: The scored jaws of a vise help it bite the work .
sentences.chinese: 臺鉗上有刻痕的虎鉗牙幫助它緊咬住工件。

sentences.english: The vice is bolted to the work-bench.
sentences.chinese: 老虎鉗是用螺栓擰在工作臺上的。

sentences.english: The vice is bolted to the work-bench .
sentences.chinese: 老虎鉗是用螺栓擰在工作臺上。

sentences.english: You could use a vise, its probably a lot easier.
sentences.chinese: 你可以使用老虎鉗，它可能更容易。

sentences.english: When ordering please advice the VISE without swivel base (W/O)or with swivel base(W).
sentences.chinese: 請於訂購時確認虎鉗爲有底或無底。

sentences.english: Never clamp a hand-held grinder in a vise.
sentences.chinese: 絕不可使用虎鉗夾住手持式研磨機。

sentences.english: The horn was split down the center into two halves with a hacksaw, while being held in a vise.
sentences.chinese: 我把角夾在臺虎鉗上用鋼鋸從中間鋸成兩半。

sentences.english: Clamp the starter in a vise.
Invert the differential case in the vise.
The scored jaws of a vise help it bite the work.
sentences.chinese: 臺鉗上有刻痕的虎鉗牙幫助它緊咬住工件。

sentences.english: Clamp crankshaft in a vice using the retainer plate.
sentences.chinese: 使用固定板將曲軸夾在老虎鉗中。
我的父親拿來個老虎鉗。

sentences.english: The teeth are large and strong, set in powerful, vise-like jaws.
sentences.chinese: 牙齒大而結實，有力，顎部想老虎鉗。
